title: Bizarre mugshot of McDonald's menace released by police
text: Share this article Share Wheeler was accused of throwing items at people and cars outside McDonald's restaurants and has now been banned from them in the Northamptonshire town of Daventry (stock image) Another McDonald's chain came under fire last month when an employee hid a mobile in the female toilets to filming sordid footage of his colleagues using the bathroom. He was caught out when someone spotted him entering the women's toilets during a night shift (stock image) Another McDonald's chain was a source of controversy in December when a pervy employee was fired after he admitted hiding cameras in the woman's toilets. Luke Whiting, 21, hid a phone in the female toilets of the McDonald's chain where he worked so he could film illicit videos of his colleagues. The pervert was caught out when a female co-worker on a night shift who saw Whiting enter the toilets on CCTV and became suspicious. Whiting pleased guilty to operating a mobile phone with the intention of enabling another person to observe someone doing a private act for the purpose of obtaining sexual gratification, at South East Suffolk Magistrates’ Court.
